recipes.name: Kabuli Pulao
recipes.description: A traditional Afghan rice dish made with lamb, raisins, and carrots.
ingredients: 1 lb lamb meat, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened and lightly browned.
Add lamb meat to the pot and cook until browned on all sides.
Add cumin, cardamom, and cinnamon to the pot and stir to combine.
Add 4 cups of water to the pot and bring to a boil.
Add basmati rice to the pot and stir to combine.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until rice is cooked and water has been absorbed.
In a separate pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add shredded carrots and raisins and cook until softened.
Serve rice topped with lamb meat and the carrot-raisin mixture.

recipes.name: Bolani
recipes.description: A savory Afghan flatbread stuffed with spiced vegetables.
directions: In a large bowl, combine flour, water, salt, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper. Knead until a smooth dough forms.
Cover dough and let rest for 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, combine mashed potatoes and chopped onion.
Divide dough into 8 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a thin circle.
Place a spoonful of the potato mixture onto one half of each circle. Fold the other half of the circle over the filling and press edges together to seal.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Cook each bolani for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with yogurt sauce.
